intro: Barlaea, commonly known as the spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Barlaea is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
